ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course really helped solidify a lot of grammar that I thought I learned in 140. Aside from grammar, the stories and plays that we read in class helped to improve my vocabulary a lot.
This is a brilliant way to refresh your memory and pick up all the nuances of French grammar, learn a lot of relevant literary vocabulary and generally improve your speaking and writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course has a very heavy and consistent workload each week. Because of this, I really did improve my vocab and grammar, but the workload was hard to manage at times. Some weeks we would have grammar work, reading, and a 2 hour movie to watch all for one day. The work was manageable but I had to work pretty hard some weeks to plan ahead.
Strength is that you really do learn a lot. There is a great variety of materials covered, from grammar to literature to film. The only weakness is that the work load is a bit too big.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would totally recommend French 150, but don't expect it to be an easy 5th class. It's a lot of work (I would say the same amount as L4 but only meets 3 times a week), but if you put in the effort it pays off. Your French will definitely improve.

I would definitely recommend this course to someone who is serious about improving their French, but I probably wouldn't recommend this class as a fifth class to take just for fun because it really is a significant amount of work.
You learn a lot if you are willing to put in the effort. Would recommend!
